page.title: 07Industry Cont
page.content: In comparison to all the activity of World War 2 there are now only 10 or 12 planes per year built at Woodford. At the moment they are building 748's, APT(advanced turboprop),Nimrod MK2 (submarine destroyer) and the Nimrod AEW MK3 (airborne early warning). At present British Aerospace employ 2,700 people,building planes as well as repairing them.Tenders are supplied to the Government for the repair of military aircraft. Barnes Wallace the famous aircraft designer researched and designed the bouncing bomb at the old flight sheds situated on one side of the aerodrome.
